author: sky.cactus
content: What is the argument for the mempool being so large?

author: sky.cactus
content: My gut (which is likely wrong or missing information) tells me that we can minimize network noise by just keeping `n` blocks worth of transactions where `n` is a number on the order of 5 to 10.

author: sky.cactus
content: We want to hang on to enough transactions such that if there is a series of quick blocks we can fill them all (as a miner) and when we receive a block we don't have to re-fetch a transaction we previously evicted from peers (as a non-mining node).
